case_vignette: A 65-year-old man of Middle Eastern descent presents with a tender, weeping mass on his right palm! Since appearing 8 months ago, the lesion has enlarged into a 0!9-cm, pink pedunculated nodule with abundant serous crust! The patient has no significant history of trauma! His medical history is significant for atrial fibrillation, hypertension, coronary artery disease, congestive heart failure, and lung cancer, which was treated with right lobectomy! It is unclear what medications were used to treat his lung cancer! His current medications include metoprolol, lisinopril, allopurinol, aspirin, and digoxin! The patient also presents with additional pink, scaly plaques on his right ankle, consistent with nummular eczema!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a tender, weeping mass on my right palm and some pink, scaly plaques on my right ankle.
How long have you had these symptoms?
The mass on my palm appeared 8 months ago, and the plaques on my ankle have been present for some time as well.
Have you noticed any changes in the size or appearance of the mass or plaques over time?
Yes, the mass on my palm has enlarged over time.
Do you have any history of similar skin issues or other chronic diseases?

No, I do not have any history of similar skin issues, but I do have chronic diseases including atrial fibrillation, hypertension, coronary artery disease, congestive heart failure, and previously treated lung cancer.
Are you currently taking any medications for your chronic conditions or any other treatments?
Yes, I am currently taking metoprolol, lisinopril, allopurinol, aspirin, and digoxin for my conditions.
Have you experienced any trauma or injury to your palm where the mass is located before it appeared?
No, I have no significant history of trauma to my palm before the mass appeared.
Is there any family history of skin diseases or autoimmune conditions?
I'm not aware of any family history of skin diseases or autoimmune conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Granuloma annulare
